runs.comm: cripes, that's a horrid start from, Woakes floating it a long way down the leg side
and much better, on a length, shaping away, Jayawardene blocks
a Woakes indipper finds the pads, to much excitement, but it was heading down the leg side
head-over-ball defence from Jayawardene to another good-length delivery
ah classical batting has a place in T20 cricket. Jayawardene proves that over and again. Here he clips straight past the bowler with a flick of the wrists
Jayawardene has struggled with the off-stump lifter all summer. Extra bounce again troubling him here
slower ball is dabbed down to third man which means Jayawardene will keep the strike
despite a very enthusiastic appeal from Kieswetter this is nothing more than a leg-side wide. Not the most blazing start to international cricket that
still Jayawardene is denied the strike as a late cut heads to deep point
the infamous Dernbach slower ball confuses Jayawardene slightly and he mistimes the cut
another slower ball is respectfully prodded back to the bowler
Jayawardene hops down the wicket and wide of leg, gets the shortish length he wants and carves over slip for four
Dernbach's response is another slower ball - offspinner this time - defended to cover to finally bring the Jayasuriya on strike
careful start from the batsman, poking a rising delivery to point
not sure what happened here for Woakes. Attempted slower ball floats invitingly up around waist-height well wide of off and Jayawardene had no choice but to cut for four
ah lovely timing. So easy, no vein-popping power. Just eased a half-volley straight back over the bowler's head for six
Four more! Jayawardene is making toast of Woakes here. Leg-stump half-volley is clipped easily for four to third man
single taken this time, some respite for Woakes as it's pushed towards cover
very hittable pace and length from Woakes and Jayasuriya crashes a drive at cover who makes a half-stop
better ball here, back of a length and pushed to midwicket
starts with a bouncer, the best in world cricket according to England's management, not sure Jayawardene is too bothered, swatting to deep square
a lovely shot, Jayasuriya opens the face and guides a shortish ball wide of slip and fine of third man for his first boundary
good delivery slices Jayasuriya in two. Back of a length, nipping in a touch and clipping the top of the pad through to Kieswetter
good, tumbling fielding from Woakes on the third-man boundary saves runs as Jayasuriya slashes at a wide delivery
having looked out of form during the Test series, Jayawardene looks in complete control here. Steers one off his legs into the midwicket region
Broad's first over as captain ends with Jayasuriya chopping to third man
not a great start from the bowler, shoving it in short and very wide of off. Jayasuriya heaved and missed
gone! One innings left for Jayasuriya then as he clubs a full delivery low to Pietersen at mid-off. Dernbach yelps with delight after getting his first international wicket
Sangakkara is the new man and is away straight away. Easing off his toes wide of mid-on for a single
another slower ball but this is very wide. Too wide for anyone's liking
good stop from Morgan at backward point as another slower ball is cut hard by Jayawardene
real allsorts from Dernbach, all kinds of slower balls he has. This is worked, eventually, to midwicket
From 66mph to 85mph in two deliveries. Good effort from the bowler. Sangakkara seems unruffled and punches down the ground
extra bounce raps Jayawardene on the gloves. His hands have taken a pounding this summer
this is tough for Broad, trying to haul England back into the match. Shortish ball is steered to third man
excellent fielding from Dernbach at third man saves a boundary as Jayawardene backs away to carve over slip
back of a length here again and rushes Jayawardene in defence

still short from Broad, with England needing wickets I'm not convinced it's the best plan. Slower ball too and Jayawardene waits on it before wheeling it around the corner, past short fine leg for four
worked to deep square and Jayawardene rushes through for a second
quick from Broad, but short too. Jayawardene looks very comfortable as he hangs leg side to guide to third man
good start, round-arm dart is straight and the batsman has to defend
touch slower this time and blocked to cover
very neatly done from Jayawardene. Gets across his stumps to fetch a sweep from outside off around the corner for four
bunted down the ground for a single this time
the Sangakkara cover drive is as elegant as ever but finds the fielder
pushed down the ground where long-on sweeps up
Swann's first delivery is nibbled into the leg side. Sri Lanka coasting and Broad is twitchy, arms waving
Jayawardene gets all low and cat-like to dab this to short third man
Sangakkara hops down the wicket and clips to deep midwicket. No fuss or effort, just class
with the required rate hovering around six an over Jayawardene is happy to dink and dab
beaten outside off stump as Swann gets one to grip
all a bit flat from England, Sangakkara works a to leg
perfectly done from Sangakkara, easing down the wicket and lifting Patel wide of the long-on boundary. Not easy to do, that
pushed through quicker and punched down the ground
Jayawardene seems to be able to take singles at will here
bosh! Sangakkara makes this into a full toss by edging down the wicket before flat-batting a swat straight of midwicket for four. Patel suffering here
after the boundary Sangakkara dips a single into space
Jayawardene could do this lying down. Finding space with a flick of the wrists
beaten outside off, Kieswetter was convinced there was an edge but Swann and the umpire weren't interested
for the first time Jayawardene aims something unconventional, reverse-sweeping. He misses
good ball from Swann is pushed back to the bowler
this time space is found as it's worked to leg
Sangakkara leans this to midwicket
quicker ball is fired down the leg side. A big no-no in limited-overs cricket
good delivery to finish is blocked into the leg side
he starts round the wicket to Sangakkara, who gets in line to defend
nice and straight once again from Bopara, and Sangakkara taps it back
nudged into the wide open spaces on the leg side - there's a single to be had there if he just gets bat on ball
quicker from Bopara, and cutting away from the right-hander off the pitch. Jayawardene stretches across but misses the cut
short and wide again, Jayawardene doesn't time the cut but gets enough on it to pick up a single and reach a 40-ball fifty
eased out through square leg for another single

speared down the leg side - clearly a wide - but Sangakkara over-balances as he tries to glance and Kieswetter whips the bails off in a flash ... ah, but the back foot remained grounded and that's not out
Sangakkara simply oozes class. He's already played a shot very similar to this one in this innings - chipping out into the deep - and once again his placement is perfect
hurled down the leg side, no potential-stumping-drama this time. Just a bad ball
full outside off, driven through the covers
looped up on off stump and Jayawardene flicks down to long-on
tip-and-run from Sangakkara, who just drops the ball into the off side and sets off
width offered outside off and Jayawardene sends the ball down to third man with a deft late cut
nudged quietly back to the bowler to end the over - another good one for Sri Lanka, 11 from it
back-of-the-hand slower ball to start, but it's lobbed down the leg side
nice and straight this time, and Sangakkara defends
short of a good length and heading down the leg side, Sangakkara helps it on its way down to fine leg
quick bouncer from Dernbach, but Sangakkara is easily underneath it
Sangakkara walks out of his crease as Dernbach approaches, only to gently angle another slower ball down to third man
short and wide, the ball pitches and comes back in a touch, cramping Jayawardene's cut. Still, he gets one for his troubles as the ball rolls out to deep point
another slower one, this one full and wide outside off. Sangakkara leans across to drive out into the deep, and they hurry back for the second
plenty of pace to start from England's skipper, but it's angled into the pads and whipped down to fine leg
this time it's Sangakkara glancing off the pads, and he picks up a single through square leg
well, it is short but it doesn't get up too sharply and the swivel pull sends the ball out to deep square
short again, this one a slightly more spicy bouncer and Sangakkara doesn't get a great connection as he hooks to midwicket ... enough on it to collect two though
much fuller on off stump this time, tapped to cover
another bouncer to finish, Sangakkara sways out of the way and has a look at the umpire ... but it's deemed a legal delivery
the bottom hand comes into the shot as Jayawardene chips out to midwicket
flicked to midwicket
Sangakkara chips now, to long-off. No risk in the shot, it was deliberate and the placement was good
quicker one from Swann, and Jayawardene eases the ball down to long-on for another single
just slightly too short from Swann, but Sangakkara is good enough to take full toll, stepping back and pulling powerfully to the midwicket boundary
whipped to midwicket to end the over
hmm, short and misdirected down the leg side - a wide
straighter, but angling towards leg stump and Jayawardene tucks off the hip for a single
cut hard towards Morgan at point, who dives to cut it off but can't stop the single
Jayawardene gives himself some room and chops a short ball on off stump down to third man
full on the pads, Sangakkara misses the whip to leg but they take a run off the leg
Brendan Taylor-esque from Jayawardene! The short ball rose up towards his throat but he just leaned back and ramped the ball up and over the keeper for four
full and straight, cracked straight back to the bowler
dibbly-dobbly on off stump, Sangakkara isn't quite sure what to do with it and nudges to midwicket
a low full-toss is chipped to wide long-on
cutting in to the right-hander off the pitch, Jayawardene flicks to midwicket and the fielder quickly hurls the ball back to the non-striker's end
Jayawardene walks across to the off side, looking for the paddle, and Bopara responds with a short ball. Can't stop the single though
pushed down the leg side, Kieswetter gets a glove on it but that's two wides
width offered outside off, Jayawardene cuts into the deep

leg-stump half-volley from Bopara, and Sangakkara chips nonchalantly out to the midwicket boundary. Didn't over-hit it at all, just timing and placement. Sangakkara's got a huge smile on his face now, he knows this match is in the bag
good yorker! Fast and straight, Jayawardene does well just to keep it out and the inside edge sends the ball to fine leg, where a sliding Luke Wright cuts it off
another inside edge to fine leg, this time Wright can't get to it and that's the game!
